title: U.K. Lawmakers Allow Scientists To Attempt 'DNA Transplants'
teaser: The British Parliament has voted to allow scientists to attempt to do "DNA transplants" on women's eggs to try to help them have healthy babies. Doctors want to do this to help families carrying devastating "mitochondrial diseases." But opponents question whether transferring DNA from healthy eggs into the eggs of women carrying these diseases is safe, and whether it would open the door to "designer babies."
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
